title-part.text: INTERNAL-COMBUSTION PISTON ENGINES
COMBUSTION ENGINES IN GENERAL

reference.text: plants in which engines use combustion products F02C, F02G; internal-combustion turbines F02C

note.note-paragraph:
In this subclass, the following terms or expressions are used with the meanings indicated: - "positive ignition" means ignition by a source external to
the working fluid, e.g. by spark or incandescent source;
- "charging" means forcing air or fuel-air mixture into
engine cylinders and thus embraces super-charging;
- "scavenging" means forcing the combustion residues from the
cylinders other than by movement of the working pistons and
thus embraces tuned exhaust systems.
Attention is drawn to the Notes preceding class F01, specially as regards Note (1).
Engines with specified cycles or number of cylinders are classified in group F02B75/02 or F02B75/16 , unless other classifying features predominate.

title-part.text: Engines characterised by the working fluid to be compressed, or characterised by the type of ignition
